thread.title: SportsDay's Big 12 Defensive Player of the Week (10/12): Texas LB Malik Jefferson records two sacks, nabs national award
thread.title_full: SportsDay's Big 12 Defensive Player of the Week (10/12): Texas LB Malik Jefferson records two sacks, nabs national award | Dallas Morning News

author: Nick Castillo
title: SportsDay's Big 12 Defensive Player of the Week (10/12): Texas LB Malik Jefferson records two sacks, nabs national award
text:
Big 12 Defensive Player of the Week
Malik Jefferson, Texas LB
Height: 6-foot-3
Weight: 232 pounds
Class: Freshman
Season stats: 37 total tackles, 5.5 tackles for loss, two sacks, one fumble recovery and one touchdown
Why he deserves it: Freshman linebacker Malik Jefferson started the season hot by averaging nine tackles during the first three games but his production went down against Oklahoma State and TCU. Jefferson had a big rebound game Saturday against the Sooners as he recorded two key sacks on Oklahoma quarterback Baker Mayfield in the Longhorns' 24-17 win. Jefferson recorded his first sack in the first quarter for a four-yard loss. He struck again in the fourth quarter with an eight-yard sack. The freshman linebacker from Mesquite finished with six total tackles and two tackles for loss. Jefferson's performance helped him earn the Walter Camp National FBS Defensive Player of the Week award.
Honorable mentions: S Derrick Kindred , TCU (seven total tackles, one interception and one touchdown); DE Emmanuel Ogbah , Oklahoma State (eight total tackles, one sack, one fumble recovery and one touchdown); LB Grant Campbell , Baylor (seven total sacks, 0.5 sacks and 0.5 tackles for loss)
